org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.script
Class ScriptProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.script.ScriptProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
MapScriptProcessor
public class ScriptProcessor
extends Component
implements IDataProcessor

Processor which executes scripts in the context of a data record.
This may be configured with a script language (default is javascript). The script to be executed may be supplied as a String, or within a file whose name is supplied. The script be executed in the context of supplied records.

Author:
higginse

boxReturnedArrays

protected boolean boxReturnedArrays
If true, then converted values will always be wrapped in an enclosing Object[], even if the result is already an array. The default value for this have been changed (after 3.3) to false. Note: Individual subclasses may well override this default for their own purposes.

setDataBinding

public void setDataBinding(java.lang.String dataBinding)
This associates the incoming data record with a bound name within the script.
Defaults to DEFAULT_DATA_BINDING

Parameters:

setBoxReturnedArrays

public void setBoxReturnedArrays(boolean boxReturnedArrays)
Flag to wrap returned Arrays in an enclosing Object[]. If true, converted result will be wrapped in an Object[] even if it is already an array. Note: The default behaviour has been changed from true to false after release 3.3

Parameters:
boxReturnedArrays -

setAdditionalBindings

public void setAdditionalBindings(java.util.Map bindingMap)
This allows additional bindings, specified in the supplied map.
For example, it may include a reference to some other bean within the adaptor.
One trivial usage might be to maintain simple state information in some other object.

Parameters:
bindingMap - Map of name to Object mappings.

This holds the last result from script execution.

Returns:
Object containing the result from last execution of the script, or null if script has not yet executed.

getScriptEngine

public javax.script.ScriptEngine getScriptEngine()
Get the ScriptEngine as generated by the ScriptEngineManager when validate() is called.

Returns:
The ScriptEngine for the ScriptEngineManager (or null if validate has not yet been called)

process

public java.lang.Object[] process(java.lang.Object data)
Process a data item. It will bind the data using the configured databinding, to make it available to the script. The bound object will be returned in a single Element Object[]
Note: If compilation is not possible, and the script is contained in a file, then the file will be read each time a datum is being processed. This should be avoided for obvious reasons :-)

Specified by:
process in interface IDataProcessor
Returns:
output, zero length array or null indicates that data was discarded

Specified by:

Parameters:
context -
See Also:
IReadConnector.getReaderContext()

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Validate the configuration of this component.
In addition it will create a script engine, and compile the supplied script if possible, via a call to initialise()

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Parameters:
exceptions - collection to which exceptions should be added. Must not be null

createScriptEngine

protected javax.script.ScriptEngine createScriptEngine()
create a ScriptEngine.
Default behaivour is to call new ScriptEngineManager().getEngineByName(language);

Returns:
creates ScriptEngine instance
